rules.natural: If compound X requires FDA review approval, then production of compound X is complete.
Either compound X requires FDA review approval or compound X is FDA approved.
Provided that compound X is manufactured properly, it passes the stability test.
Compound X exceeds the toxicity limit or has an incorrect dosage.
Under the condition that compound X has an incorrect dosage, it is FDA approved.

If compound X passes quality control, then, in case it is not the case that whenever compound X does not exceed the toxicity limit it is FDA approved and requires additional testing, then compound X has a delayed release.
Provided that compound X has defective packaging, it is FDA approved.
If compound X has incorrect labeling, then it is FDA approved.
Compound X has approved marketing or compound X is regulatory compliant.
Whenever compound X contains heavy metals as a contaminant, it fails the purity test.
Compound X contains heavy metals as a contaminant or compound X contains microorganisms as a contaminant.
Under the condition that compound X is regulatory compliant, it has defective packaging or incorrect labeling.
If compound X has a complete safety review, then, provided that it has approved marketing, it has approved distribution.
Compound X has a complete safety review or compound X has confirmed efficacy.
Whenever compound X has confirmed efficacy, then, if it has approved marketing, it has approved distribution.
If compound X meets standards, then, provided that it is not FDA approved, it is not eligible for fast track.
Under the condition that compound X has conditional approval, then, if it is not FDA approved, it is not eligible for fast track.
If compound X has full approval, then it is market ready.
Compound X has full approval or compound X has limited approval.
Whenever compound X has limited approval, it has conditional approval.
Under the condition that compound X is market ready, it meets standards.
If compound X contains microorganisms as a contaminant, then it does not require FDA review approval.
Provided that compound X has batch consistency, it passes quality assurance.
Compound X has batch consistency or compound X has stability issues.
Whenever compound X has stability issues, production of compound X is not complete.
If compound X has a complete risk assessment, then, in case it is not the case that exceeding the toxicity limit implies FDA approval, it requires additional testing.
Under the condition that compound X has a validated manufacturing process, then, if it does not have a complete risk assessment, it needs additional monitoring.
Provided that compound X has calibrated equipment, it has malfunctioning equipment.
If compound X has calibrated equipment, then it does not have malfunctioning equipment.
Compound X has calibrated equipment or compound X has a validated manufacturing process.

If compound X has active post-market surveillance, then, in case it is not the case that when it is not true that exceeding the toxicity limit implies FDA approval and it requires additional testing, leading to a delayed release, then it does not have an initiated recall.
Whenever compound X fails the purity test, it is rejected for consumption.
Provided that compound X has approved logistics, it has a secured supply chain.
Compound X has approved logistics or compound X has arranged transportation.
Provided that compound X has an established distribution network, it has contracted wholesalers.
Under the condition that compound X has contracted wholesalers, it has supplied hospitals.
If compound X has stocked pharmacies, then, provided that it has arranged transportation, it has approved distribution, or defective packaging, or incorrect labeling.
Whenever compound X has supplied hospitals, it has serviced clinics.
If compound X has serviced clinics, then it has stocked pharmacies.
Under the condition that compound X is rejected for consumption, it does not require FDA review approval.
If compound X passes the stability test, then it is not approved for trials.
If it is not true that needing reformulation implies passing the safety test, then compound X is approved for trials.

Under the condition that it is not true that when compound X does not have the implication that not exceeding the toxicity limit implies FDA approval and it requires additional testing, leading to a delayed release, then recall is initiated for compound X.
Provided that compound X does not have a complete risk assessment, it does not need additional monitoring.
Under the condition that compound X does not have active post-market surveillance, it has reported adverse events.
If compound X does not have active post-market surveillance, then it does not have reported adverse events.
Provided that compound X is not FDA approved, it is eligible for fast track.
Whenever compound X is not FDA approved, it needs reformulation.

Compound X does not have approved distribution.
Compound X does not pass quality assurance.

Compound X does not pass the safety test.

(A1 → A29).natural: If compound X requires FDA review approval, then production of compound X is complete.

(A10 → A9).natural: Provided that compound X is manufactured properly, it passes the stability test.

(A11 → G).natural: Whenever compound X exceeds the toxicity limit, it is FDA approved.

(A11 ∨ A12).natural: Compound X exceeds the toxicity limit or has an incorrect dosage.

(A15 → (¬(¬(A11 → G) → A13) → A14)).natural: If compound X passes quality control, then, in case it is not the case that whenever compound X does not exceed the toxicity limit it is FDA approved and requires additional testing, then compound X has a delayed release.

(A16 → G).natural: Provided that compound X has defective packaging, it is FDA approved.

(A16 ∨ A17).natural: Either compound X has defective packaging or compound X has incorrect labeling.

(A18 ∨ (A16 ∨ A17)).natural: Compound X has approved distribution, or compound X has defective packaging, or compound X has incorrect labeling.

(A19 → A18).natural: Under the condition that compound X has approved marketing, it has approved distribution.

(A19 ∨ A20).natural: Compound X has approved marketing or compound X is regulatory compliant.

(A2 → A4).natural: Whenever compound X contains heavy metals as a contaminant, it fails the purity test.

(A2 ∨ A3).natural: Compound X contains heavy metals as a contaminant or compound X contains microorganisms as a contaminant.

(A20 → (A16 ∨ A17)).natural: Under the condition that compound X is regulatory compliant, it has defective packaging or incorrect labeling.

(A21 → (A19 → A18)).natural: If compound X has a complete safety review, then, provided that it has approved marketing, it has approved distribution.

(A21 ∨ A22).natural: Compound X has a complete safety review or compound X has confirmed efficacy.

(A22 → (A19 → A18)).natural: Whenever compound X has confirmed efficacy, then, if it has approved marketing, it has approved distribution.

(A24 → (¬G → ¬A23)).natural: If compound X meets standards, then, provided that it is not FDA approved, it is not eligible for fast track.

(A24 ∨ A25).natural: Either compound X meets standards or compound X has conditional approval.

(A25 → (¬G → ¬A23)).natural: Under the condition that compound X has conditional approval, then, if it is not FDA approved, it is not eligible for fast track.

(A26 → A24).natural: Provided that compound X has full approval, it meets standards.

(A3 → ¬A1).natural: If compound X contains microorganisms as a contaminant, then it does not require FDA review approval.

(A30 ∨ ¬A29).natural: Compound X passes quality assurance or production of compound X is not complete.

(A31 ∨ A32).natural: Compound X has batch consistency or compound X has stability issues.

(A32 → ¬A29).natural: Whenever compound X has stability issues, production of compound X is not complete.
